Trial_Design.evidence: A dose escalation Phase I clinical trial

Participants.evidence: patients with suspected stage I/II NSCLC

Intervention.evidence: NIR imaging following peritumoral injection of 3.8 – 2500 μg indocyanine green (ICG)

Objective.evidence: Our objective was to perform a dose escalation study to assess safety and feasibility of intraoperative near-infrared (NIR) fluorescence imaging

Method_Outcome.evidence: Visualization of lymphatic migration, SLN identification, and adverse events were recorded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty eight patients underwent ICG injection and NIR imaging

Result_Outcome.evidence: SLN identification increased with ICG dose with <25% SLN detected in dose cohorts ≤600ug vs 89% success at ≥1000 μg.
